arts.ttl: Crystal Palace go fourth as hopeless Wolves sink to depressing new low
arts.sum: Wolverhampton Wanderers do not get the new manager bounce they were hoping for as Rob Edward's debut ends in a 2-0 Premier League defeat to Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace into top four as Edwards loses first game as Wolves boss
arts.sum: Crystal Palace comfortably beat Wolverhampton Wanderers to move into fourth in the Premier League and condemn Rob Edwards to a defeat in his first game in charge at Wolves.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner spotted having ‘extremely long conversation’ with Wolves star at full-time
arts.sum: Wolves' best performer in the disappointing Crystal Palace loss? Wolves’ best performer in the disappointing Crystal Palace loss?

arts.ttl: Rob Edwards admits Wolves were punished in big moments against Crystal Palace
arts.sum: Daniel Munoz and Yeremy Pino scored in quick succession in the second half.

arts.ttl: Rob Edwards releases statement following Wolves' 2-0 defeat to Crystal Palace
arts.sum: Rob Edwards would have been hoping for much more in his first game as Wolves head coach. Rob Edwards believes Wolves need to give themselves confidence

arts.ttl: Hi-Ho, Edwards energy and anti-VAR chants: Three things you may have missed from Wolves' defeat to Crystal Palace
arts.sum: It was a good touch by those at Wolves, with the atmosphere ramping up ahead of the game to kick off the Edwards era. With regards to his side, he was kicking every ball certainly in that first half, almost pulling players into position, calling for calm when the game was frantic.

arts.ttl: Adam Wharton impressed by one thing about Wolves in Rob Edwards’ first game
arts.sum: The Old Gold did not start well, and they could have conceded an early penalty after a controversial VAR call, but instead they got to the hour mark with the game at 0-0. Wolves fans will be feeling disappointed after suffering yet another loss in the Premier League, but midfielder Adam Wharton’s comments have offered a positive perspective.

arts.ttl: Pino stunner for Crystal Palace inflicts painful start on Rob Edwards at Wolves
arts.sum: It was in the 69th minute when Yeremy Pino wheeled away in celebration after doubling Crystal Palace’s lead, his delicious shot from the edge of the area crashing in off the underside of the crossbar. In the away technical area, Oliver Glasner was also on the move, the Palace manager briefly dancing on ice as he almost lost his footing. By the end, the delirious away supporters were asking their goalkeeper Dean, Henderson, for song suggestions. For Wolves and Rob Edwards, this his first game in permanent charge, there was only more pain. Pino scored six minutes after Daniel Muñoz opened the scoring to earn a win that propels Palace into fourth. Wolves remain on two points and rooted to the bottom of the Premier League after a dozen matches; they are the only winless team in the top seven tiers of English football and hurtling towards the Championship. arts.ttl: Crystal Palace spoil Rob Edwards’ Wolves homecoming
arts.sum: Daniel Munoz and Yeremy Pino’s second-half strikes saw Palace to a 2-0 win at Molineux.

arts.ttl: Palace up to fourth as Wolves remain winless
arts.sum: Crystal Palace moved up to fourth in the Premier League with a 2-0 win over Wolves at Molineux as Rob Edwards’ first game ended in defeat.
